skill.name: dispatching-parallel-agents
skill.description: Dispatches one subagent per independent domain to parallelize investigation/fixes. Use when you have 2+ unrelated failures (e.g., separate failing test files, subsystems, bugs) with no shared state or ordering dependencies.
skill.summary: Dispatches one subagent per independent domain to parallelize investigation/fixes. Use when you have...
skill.author: CodingCossack

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation, workflow guidelines, and prompt templates. No executable code, scripts, network calls, file system access, or external command execution.

content.user_title: Dispatch parallel agents for independent failures
content.value_statement: Fixing multiple unrelated test failures wastes time when done sequentially. This skill provides a proven workflow to identify independent problems, dispatch focused agents in parallel, and integrate fixes efficiently without conflicts.
actual_capabilities: Identifies independent problem domains across failing tests
Creates focused agent tasks with clear scope and constraints
Dispatches multiple agents to work concurrently
Reviews results and detects conflicts between agent changes
Integrates fixes while avoiding merge conflicts
limitations: Requires failures to be truly independent with no shared state
Cannot automatically detect dependencies between test files
Agents must follow provided constraints to avoid conflicts
One owner per file is required to prevent merge issues

use_cases.title: Parallelize test fixes
use_cases.description: Dispatch multiple agents to fix separate test files simultaneously when refactoring causes failures across subsystems.

use_cases.title: Fix unrelated subsystems
use_cases.description: Handle infrastructure tests, integration tests, and unit tests that fail independently after deployment changes.

use_cases.title: Scale debugging efforts
use_cases.description: Coordinate fixing bugs across different modules without waiting for sequential completion of each fix.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Dispatch
prompt_templates.prompt:
Task("Fix [file-name-1].test.ts failures")
Task("Fix [file-name-2].test.ts failures")
Task("Fix [file-name-3].test.ts failures")

prompt_templates.title: Detailed Task
prompt_templates.prompt: Fix the [N] failing tests in [file path]. Each test: [name] - [error]. Context: [background]. Goal: [specific approach]. Return: Summary.

prompt_templates.title: Conflict Resolution
prompt_templates.prompt: Review all agent summaries. Check for file conflicts where two agents touched the same file. If conflicts exist, stop and re-scope with one owner per file.

prompt_templates.title: Integration Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Run full test suite. If failures remain: check for merge conflicts, resolve manually, or investigate as new independent failures. Repeat until green.

output_examples.input: Six tests are failing across three files after our refactor: agent-tool-abort.test.ts has 3 timing failures, batch-completion-behavior.test.ts has 2 execution failures, tool-approval-race-conditions.test.ts has 1 count failure.
output: All fixes independent, no conflicts, full suite green after integration

best_practices: Verify failures are truly independent before parallelizing
Give each agent clear scope constraints to prevent scope creep
Always review for conflicts before merging agent results
Use event-based waiting instead of arbitrary timeouts
anti_patterns: Assigning "fix all tests" without specific file scope
Pasting vague errors without test names or file paths
Skipping conflict review when multiple agents touch code
Using "fix it" instead of specifying required output format

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. The Task function is native to Claude Code but prompt templates adapt to any agentic tool.

faq.question: How many agents can I dispatch at once?
faq.answer: No hard limit. Dispatch one agent per independent failure domain. Consider your tool concurrency limits and context window size.

faq.question: What if I cannot identify independent domains?
faq.answer: Investigate failures together first. Only parallelize when you are certain domains are independent with no shared state or ordering dependencies.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my codebase?
faq.answer: No. This skill only provides prompts and workflow guidance. The agents you dispatch will make changes based on their assigned constraints.

faq.question: What causes merge conflicts between agents?
faq.answer: Two agents editing the same file. Stop and re-scope with one owner per file. Prevents this by defining clear scope boundaries upfront.

faq.question: How is this different from sequential fixing?
faq.answer: Agents work concurrently on separate problems. Three independent failures take the time of one instead of three sequential fixes.
